channel.title: [PI] Disabling Item Disappearing
channel.description: I'm making a Dungeoneering base and I would like to disable items disappearing after a certain time period when they're on the ground. Can this be done by just editing something? Any help is appreciated.

item.title: [PI] Disabling Item Disappearing
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“m0ssyh0s, post:7, topic:477108”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=595301.msg4191749#msg4191749 date=1356909850]

Why dont you make like an table and if u clicks it. It opens an interface which allow you to chose weapons. This wud make it unique and epic

I can do this for some features but I also have the gatestone added and it disappears after a certain time period. If players want to change where their gatestone coords are, they have to pick their gatestone back up and drop it again.

Are you worried about them loosing their gatestone?

And also item drops from the monsters that they kill.
[/quote]

If I were you, I would make your own Dungeoneering Ground Items class, so that you can modify it without effecting the rest of the game. You could rip most of the code from the Item classes already in PI.[/quote]
I have everything that is included in dungeoneering under a boolean that toggles whenever a player is in a dungeon or not. So editing the item disappearing will not affect the rest of the game.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Disabling Item Disappearing
item.dc:creator: @m0ssyh0s m0ssyh0s
item.description:
@m0ssyh0s wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:6, topic:477108”][quote author=m0ssyh0s link=topic=595301.msg4191747#msg4191747 date=1356909592]

Why dont you make like an table and if u clicks it. It opens an interface which allow you to chose weapons. This wud make it unique and epic

I can do this for some features but I also have the gatestone added and it disappears after a certain time period. If players want to change where their gatestone coords are, they have to pick their gatestone back up and drop it again.

Are you worried about them loosing their gatestone?
[/quote]

And also item drops from the monsters that they kill.[/quote]

If I were you, I would make your own Dungeoneering Ground Items class, so that you can modify it without effecting the rest of the game. You could rip most of the code from the Item classes already in PI.

Read full topic

Why dont you make like an table and if u clicks it. It opens an interface which allow you to chose weapons. This wud make it unique and epic

I can do this for some features but I also have the gatestone added and it disappears after a certain time period. If players want to change where their gatestone coords are, they have to pick their gatestone back up and drop it again.
[/quote]

Are you worried about them loosing their gatestone?[/quote]

And also item drops from the monsters that they kill.

item.title: [PI] Disabling Item Disappearing
item.dc:creator: @m0ssyh0s m0ssyh0s
item.description:
@m0ssyh0s wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:4, topic:477108”][quote author=luna-scape link=topic=595301.msg4191734#msg4191734 date=1356908678]
Why dont you make like an table and if u clicks it. It opens an interface which allow you to chose weapons. This wud make it unique and epic
[/quote]
I can do this for some features but I also have the gatestone added and it disappears after a certain time period. If players want to change where their gatestone coords are, they have to pick their gatestone back up and drop it again.[/quote]

Are you worried about them loosing their gatestone?

item.title: [PI] Disabling Item Disappearing
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

luna-scape:

Why dont you make like an table and if u clicks it. It opens an interface which allow you to chose weapons. This wud make it unique and epic

I can do this for some features but I also have the gatestone added and it disappears after a certain time period. If players want to change where their gatestone coords are, they have to pick their gatestone back up and drop it again.

[quote=“m0ssyh0s, post:3, topic:477108”]I don’t know for sure how to do this and I’ll look into it when I’m not busy, but to point you in the right direction, it (probably) has to do with the createGroundItem() method in ItemHandler.java.

Edit : There is a variable HIDE_TICKS in there, you probably need to call createGroundItem() somewhere but instead of using HIDE_TICKS as a parameter, put like 10000 or something. Again, I’m not really sure.[/quote]
I think I found out what I can do to disable it whenever players are in a dungeon, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Disabling Item Disappearing
item.dc:creator: @m0ssyh0s m0ssyh0s
item.description:
@m0ssyh0s wrote:

I don’t know for sure how to do this and I’ll look into it when I’m not busy, but to point you in the right direction, it (probably) has to do with the createGroundItem() method in ItemHandler.java.

Edit : There is a variable HIDE_TICKS in there, you probably need to call createGroundItem() somewhere but instead of using HIDE_TICKS as a parameter, put like 10000 or something. Again, I’m not really sure.

Read full topic
